การแตกตัวของ Bitcoin ดำเนินต่อไป: ระดับต่ำสุดในรอบ 14 เดือนจุดชนวนความกลัวว่าจะตกลงไปต่ำกว่า $60K

Bitcoin Breakdown Continues: 14-Month Low Sparks Fears of a Deeper Fall Below $60K

1d ago//Dimitar Dzhondzhorov
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

Bitcoin (BTC) ร่วงลงสู่ระดับต่ำสุดในรอบ 14 เดือน โดยดิ่งผ่าน $70,000 มาอยู่ที่ระดับประมาณ $69,300 จุดชนวนความกังวลเรื่องการแกว่งตัวลงไปอีก นักวิเคราะห์อย่าง Ali Martinez เตือนว่าการหลุดเส้น 100-week SMA อาจนำไปสู่การร่วงลงสู่ $57,600 ในขณะที่ผู้เชี่ยวชาญบางคนคาดการณ์ว่าราคาอาจจมลงไปถึง $30,000 หรือ $25,000 ลัธธิการเชิงลบนี้ได้รับการสนับสนุนจากข้อมูลที่แสดงให้เห็นว่าปริมาณ Bitcoin บนเว็บเทรด (Exchange) เพิ่มสูงขึ้น ซึ่งบ่งชี้ว่านักลงทุนกำลังย้ายสินทรัพย์ไปขาย

EN

Bitcoin (BTC) has dropped to a 14-month low, falling below $70,000 to trade around $69,300, sparking fears of a deeper decline. Analysts like Ali Martinez warn that losing the 100-week SMA could lead to a drop toward $57,600, while other experts predict prices could sink as low as $30,000 or $25,000. This bearish sentiment is supported by data showing increasing BTC reserves on exchanges, suggesting investors are moving assets to sell.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin falls below $70,000 to a 14-month low amid broader market crash.
  • Analysts predict potential further drops to support levels between $57,600 and $25,000.
  • Rising exchange reserves suggest investors are preparing to sell, increasing bearish pressure.
  • The RSI is at 19, indicating the asset is oversold and a potential rebound could occur.

Article

Is BTC headed for a crash to $25,000? Bitcoin (BTC) has experienced a steep decline over the past weeks, mirroring the broader crypto market crash. According to some analysts and experts, the situation could worsen for bulls in the short term, with the price at risk of falling below $60,000. Fasten Your Belts Just recently, the leading cryptocurrency tumbled below $70,000 for the first time since November 2024. As of press time, it trades at around $69,300, down 21% over the past week alone. The renowned analyst Ali Martinez suggested that the bears might be just stepping in. He reminded that since 2015, every time BTC has lost the 100-week simple moving average (SMA), it has failed to reclaim it in time and continued toward the 200-week SMA. According to his chart, the price could drop to as low as $57,600. Prior to that, Martinez claimed that the next key support levels for BTC after the drop under $77,086 are $60,176 and $47,824. The trader, using the X handle Hardy, also recently made a pessimistic prediction. They envisioned a massive decline in the coming months, with the bottom set at roughly $30,000. Meanwhile, PlanB (the anonymous creator of the Stock-to-Flow (S2F) model) believes several scenarios are possible, including a collapse to $25,000 and a retreat to $50,000- $60,000. The analyst took it to X to ask the followers for their take on the matter. Nearly half of the participants think a plunge to $50K-$60K is the most plausible option, while only 15% see the valuation nosediving to $25K. PlanB Survey, Source: X Recent investor behavior supports the bearish thesis. According to data from CryptoQuant, the amount of BTC held on exchanges has been rising over the past few weeks. This suggests that many market participants have moved their holdings from self-custody to centralized platforms, typically interpreted as a pre-sale step. You may also like: Bitcoin’s Rollercoaster Ride Continues as BTC Price Recovers $10K in a Day CZ’s ‘Poor Again’ Tweet Backfires as Nebraskangooner Slams Binance Santiment: Crowd Fear Triggers Bitcoin Bounce, $70K Rally in Focus BTC Exchange Reserves, Source: CryptoQuant Is It Really Over? While BTC’s current condition may appear weak, several indicators suggest a potential rebound ahead. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) measures the speed and magnitude of recent price changes. It ranges from 0 to 100, and anything below 30 means that the asset is oversold and due for a potential resurgence. On the contrary, ratios above 70 are considered bearish territory. As of this writing, the RSI stands at roughly 19.
